result.execSummary:
The defendant Shanice A Stands was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3).

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shanice A Stands

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: granting funeral leave, transportation provided by LS, raeturn by 7:00 p.m. March 18
granting petition to transfer from Forest Co Jail to Marathon Co Jail
requesting transfer from Forest Co Jail to Marathon Co Jail

Called at 10:41 AM. Also called 14CF16. Shanice Stands appears in person and with counsel Jeff Joy. State appears by Charles Simono. State has reviewed the PSI and does not see any need for changes or clarifications. Joy has PSI and has reviewed it and makes one clarification on it regarding meeting with the P&P and not sure about proceeding today and the decision that P&P came to in regards to recommendations. State makes statement and asks for clarification of Joy's comments. Court reviews PSI again and goes over those issues. Joy is ready to proceed today but wanted it on the record regarding statements in the PSI and problems with meeting with P&P. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - has complied with victim notification requirements with no response except for a letter of support for the defendant - submits Ex #1 - lab report of blood tests of defendant (received after no objections - 10:55 AM) - recommends on 13CF239 a 8 year prison sentence consisting of 3 years of initial confinement followed by 5 years of Extended Supervision; on 14CF16 - recommends 3 years probation - consecutive to ES on 13CF239. Joy makes final argument prior to sentencing - on 13CF239 - recommends a probation sentence with conditional jail time of 9-12 months and allow Mr. Knudson to facilitate her financials while incarcreated - provides Court with a copy of agreement with Knudson for her finances - State has no objections to it as long as it is inclusive of all her finances/income, also provides court with a letter from defendant's mother (different from the one contained in the PSI). Stands makes statement, remorseful. Joy makes additional comment. Court reviews letter submitted by Joy. Court sentences the defendant to the following: on 14CF16 - 1 year in FC jail - huber and good time allowed - community service under 973.03(3) - report today, fine of $5000 inclusive of costs and assessments - take bond posted. On 13CF239 - impose 8 years in WI Prison System system consisting of 3 years of initial confinement followed by 5 years of ES, stayed, place on probation for 5 years, consecutive to jail time on 14CF16, conditions of probation include: 1 year in FC jail - huber but not good time - community service under 973.20, AODA and follow thru, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars, within 30 days of release of incareration - completed at no less than 20 hours of community service per week if unemployed but a total of 250 hours of community service, follow thru with all mental evaluations and assessmesnts and any treatment plans that develop from that, take all meds as prescibed and in the manner in which they are prescribed, enroll in anger management and successfuly complete it - to be completed within the first 6 months of probation, enroll and participate in a parenting program and successfully complete - within first 6 months of probation, $5000 fine inclusive of costs - paid thru probation, maintain full time employment/school with verbage, must agree to the appointment of a conservatorship imposed either by Tribal Court or Circuit Court appointing a non-family member as conservator for any income or assets she owns or is entitled to thru per cap or employment and dispose of with her interests subject to approval of the courts, if after 8 months of conditional jail time she has gained employment/school and conservatoship is in place - Court will stay the last 4 months of jail to work/attend school and will be reimposed any time she is not full time employed/school, attend at least one AA/NA meeting each week, submit to random urine/blood tests, submit DNA sample with surcharge assessed - paid thru probation, additional DNA surcharge on each count for each case - paid thru probation on this case and 60 days to pay on 14CF16, no possession of firearms, no voting rights. State asks for clarification of the work/school condition on the jail time. Court clarifies. Court not using agreement provided by Joy for stated reasons.
state's settlement recommendation

Called at 9:08 AM. Also called 13CF239 and 14CF16. Shanice Stands appears in person and with counsel Jeff Joy. State appears by Charles Simono. State - have matters resolved - 13CF174 - defendant would be entering a G plea to count #1 as alleged, amend count #2 to 1st offense possession of THC contrary to 941.61(3g)(e) - G, DRI #3 and #4; 13CF239 - plead G to count #2 as alleged and DRI #1; 14CF16 - plead G to count #1 as alleged, DRI #2, #3 and #4; PSI will be ordered, State's recommendations on 13CF174 are #1 - $1520.00 fine and 13 month DL suspension, #2 - $1000.00 fine plus costs and surcharges; 14CF16 - #1 - $1000.00 fine plus costs. Joy and Stands agree. Court instructs parties that he is not likely to postpone jail time on count #1 on 13CF174. Joy discusses that with his client - defendant will still proceed today. Stands pleads G to count #1 as alleged on 13CF174. Court amends count #2 to 1st possession of THC - Stands pleads G to amended count #2; Stands pleads G to count #2 as alleged on 13CF239; Stands pleads G to count #1 as alleged on 14CF16. Court dismisses and reads in counts #3 and #4 on 13CF174; dismisses and reads in count #1 on 13CF239, dismisses and reads in ciunts #2, #3 and #4 on 14CF16. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, will hear argument for PSI. Court receives certified driving record of the defendant. State has complied with victim notification requirements. State - request PSI - bound by range as set forth it PSI - argues for need of PSI. Joy argues for PSI - argues for no remand until sentencing. Court will order a PSI on 13CF239 and on 14CF16 - will modify bond to attend at least one AA/NA or similar treatment each week plus other conditiosn already imposed, follow any treatment plans that resulted from her recent inpatient stay. Joy makes final argument prior to sentencing on 13CF174 and 14CF16 - asks for time to report until sentenced on 13CF239 and minimum sentence consistent with 9th district guidelines. Stands makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 13CF174 - #2 - fine of $1000.00 fine plus costs and surcharges - 60 DTP/CO; #1 - 11 days in FC jail - huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3) - credit for 8 days - report today, fine of $1520.00 - 60 DTP/CO, 13 month DL revocation, AODA, IID for 13 months commencing upon issuance of valid DL, right to appeal, adjurned.
Sentencing hearing on August 27, 2014 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Shanice A Stands
Current: 1103 Parcher Street, Wausau, WI 54403 United States  (Effective: 06-25-2014)
Prior: 5554 Kwe Da Kik Ct, Crandon, WI 54520

Called at 2:23 PM. Also called 13CF239 and 14CF16. Shanice Stands does not appear but her attorney Jeff Joy does appear. State appears by Charles Simono. Discussion on the lack of appearance by the defendant. State - if the defendant can be here in the AM - would be willing to hold off on issuing a warrant until tomorrow. Court will not issue a warrant at this point, all matters will be scheduled for a plea hearing at 9:00 AM.

Defendant Shanice A Stands in court, in custody by video with attorney Jeffery A Joy.  Jodie L Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 1:27 PM. Joy asks court to review bond. Currently sitting on revocation sentence but to be released shortly. Asking for reduction to $1500.00. State objects. Joy responds. Court continues bond as is.
Bail/bond hearing on June 11, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Called at 10:26 AM. Also called 12CF192, 13CF11, 14CF16, and 13CF239. Shanice Stands appears in person and in custody with counsel Jeff Joy. State appears by Charles Simono. Court will reset 12CF192 and 13CF11 for sentencing after revocation on 5/21/14 at 2:00 PM for stated reasons. Joy will be waiving PH on 14CF16, recess to fill out form (10:29 AM). Back on record at 10:30 AM, Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial, will proceed to ARGN. State files Information that mirrors complaint. Joy has Information, waives reading of it, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond. Joy - on 13CF174 and 13CF239 - no resolution on 13CF239 and would like to get a global resolution, will need to set 13CF239 for JT, has gone over Frye with the defendant in regards to rejecting the plea offer. Court sets 13CF239 for JT on 6/25 thru 6/27 (backing up another 3-day JT), continues bond. On 13CF174, set for one day JT on 7/24/14 at 8:30 AM, continue bond. Court sets 14CF16 for FPT on 6/25/14 at 1:00 PM. Adjourned.
Final pre-trial on June 25, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
state

records.addlTxt: Called at 3:28 PM. Also called 13CF239 and 14CF16. Shanice Stands appears in person and in custody with attorney Jeff Joy. State appearas by Charles Simono. Joy - waiving PH and provides court with form. Court find the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State files Information on 13CF174 and 13CF239 that mirrors both complaints. Joy has Informations for both cases, waives reading of all, pleads NG to all counts on those two cases. Court accepts plea, continues bond, set both those matters for a FPT on 5/14/14 at 10:00 AM. On 14CF16, same appearances. Joy given complaint in court, waives reading of it. Court will set for PH on this matter. Joy will waive time limits and sets for PH on 5/14/14 at 10:30 AM. Court - bond - $5000.00 cash bond on new case.
Preliminary hearing on May 14, 2014 at 10:30 am.
